triples.name: Markov decision process
triples.relevance: Policy iteration is a fundamental algorithm in MDPs for finding optimal policies in probabilistic systems.

triples.name: Optimal control
triples.relevance: The paper studies optimal control problems with infinite horizon average cost criterion for probabilistic Boolean networks.

triples.name: Boolean network
triples.relevance: Probabilistic Boolean control networks are a key model system studied in this paper.

triples.name: Laurent series
triples.relevance: Laurent series expression technique is employed to derive the novel policy iteration algorithm.

triples.name: Jordan normal form
triples.relevance: Jordan decomposition method is used to derive the policy iteration-type algorithm for optimal control.

triples.name: Tensor product
triples.relevance: Semitensor product of matrices is a novel matrix operation framework proposed for analyzing probabilistic Boolean networks.

triples.name: L-arabinose operon
triples.relevance: The L-arabinose operon in E. coli serves as a biological application to demonstrate the proposed control approach.

triples.name: Escherichia coli
triples.relevance: E. coli is used as the biological system for the intervention problem case study application.

triples.name: Full state feedback
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel optimal state feedback law derived from the policy iteration algorithm for PBCN control.
